question.title: Play framework execute raw sql at start of request?

node.contents: Recently started using play 2.1.x. I wonder what is the best way of executing a raw sql query once per request? I use postgres and need to specify what schema - "set search_path to..."-type of query once per request.

astNode.text: Recently started using play 2.1.x. I wonder what is the best way of executing a raw sql query once per request? I use postgres and need to specify what schema - "set search_path to..."-type of query once per request.

node.contents: I configured postgres with jdbc and it connects fine, found some old comment that play.db.DB is supposed to have an executeQuery method but it doesn't anymore?

astNode.text: I configured postgres with jdbc and it connects fine, found some old comment that play.db.DB is supposed to have an executeQuery method but it doesn't anymore?

node.contents: To run code for each request I have overridden the "onRequest" method of the GlobalSettings class:

astNode.text: To run code for each request I have overridden the "onRequest" method of the GlobalSettings class:

elements.contents: @Override public Action onRequest(Request request, Method actionMethod) { //play.api.db.DB.executeQuery(); // -- This does not exist? return super.onRequest(request, actionMethod); }

comments.text: //play.api.db.DB.executeQuery(); // -- This does not exist? return super.onRequest(request, actionMethod); }

node.contents: I don't know if this is the best way todo it either, any help would be appreciated. I can't change the underlying architecture, I do need to set the search path to schema =)

astNode.text: I don't know if this is the best way todo it either, any help would be appreciated. I can't change the underlying architecture, I do need to set the search path to schema =)

node.contents: You are mistakenly looking at the scala docs I think. Check these:

astNode.text: You are mistakenly looking at the scala docs I think. Check these:

node.contents: You probably want to use play.db.DB.getConnection(), which returns a java.sql.Connection. Then you have the standard java api at your disposal.

astNode.text: You probably want to use play.db.DB.getConnection(), which returns a java.sql.Connection. Then you have the standard java api at your disposal.

elements.contents: String sql = "..."; Connection conn = play.db.DB.getConnection(); try { Statement stmt = conn.createStatement(); try { stmt.execute(sql) } finally { stmt.close(); } } finally { conn.close(); }

units.rawText: String sql = "..."; Connection conn = play.db.DB.getConnection(); try { Statement stmt = conn.createStatement(); try { stmt.execute(sql) } finally { stmt.close(); } } finally { conn.close(); }
